title.narrative: Global and Regional Integrated Environmental Assessments

description.narrative: In a rapidly changing world there is a continuing need to provide up-to-date information and knowledge on the world’s environment situation. Policy and decision-makers worldwide require credible scientific data on environmental, social and economic issues at global and regional scales as a basis for sound decision-making in the context of pursuing a pathway towards environmental sustainability and sustainable development.This project will deliver a series of policy-relevant, comprehensive, integrated environmental assessments (IEAs) that provide the current state and trends of the environment at global and regional scales, as well as providing policy options and an outlook, to inform UNEA, support UNEP’s strategic direction, and provide the evidence base for sound decision-making at multiple scales. The assessments will draw from the substantive body of relevant scientific information being produced both within UNEP from its programme of work, and also from external partners, institutions and relevant processes.The assessment processes will follow international best practice and be guided by scientific and intergovernmental and multi-stakeholder advisory boards to result in scientifically credible and policy relevant findings. The process will be conducted in a transparent and inclusive manner involving a wide range of institutions and experts, and will also build the capacity of a wide range of stakeholders to participate in the assessment process.
